name: Premier Inn London Euston

reviews.text: I was on layover in London due to Heathrow cancelling flights for three days. Finding three nights of accomidations at Premier Inn was the best idea!
reviews.title: BEST SERVICE! Great Rooms! Great Prices!

reviews.text: The service is beyond any expectation of such a busy hotel. The front desk staff were some of the most personable people I met during my stay in London. The rooms were cozy and clean, water was very hot with good pressure.
reviews.title: Great Hotel if you are visiting the west end

reviews.text: Definitely going to be looking for Premier Inns from now on!
reviews.title: Generally very good

reviews.text: Stayed here just before christmas for a night out with the boys. The room was warm and cosy with great comfortable bed, large LCD TV and tea and coffee in the room. Unfortunately I was taken by the Flu and had to spend the evening and the following morning in bed. I put the "do not disturb" sign on the door and was left in complete silence to recover. I would recommend a room on the side as the road at the front was busy and might have been noisy.
reviews.title: Really Nice Hotel - Great for Groups

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel for a short stay in London. All in all a clean, convenient and good value hotel.
reviews.title: Staff make all the difference here

reviews.text: I selected this hotel based on it's location and many positive reviews on this site. We were in London April 19-24 visiting our son who is a student at UCL and dorming in the area. Our experience lived up to and even exceeded my expectations based on the reviews. Although this is a budget, no-frills chain the hotel and rooms were immaculately clean, the staff were friendly and helpful, and as promised we had a great nights sleep on comfy beds. An appreciative shout out to Luke, the manager, who made our arrival a pleasure and always had a good suggestion when we needed one. Premier is lucky to have you.
reviews.title: didn't disappoint

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tips and info: We did have a room in the rear as some recommended to avoid street noise. We heard none. Pret-a-Manger down the street is great for coffee, muffins, yogurt, sandwiches, etc. Better than Costa in the hotel. Ladies, the only toiletries that are included is an all-in-one shampoo/body wash dispenser on the wall in the shower and a hand soap dispenser near the sink. We found this adequate but others may want to come prepared with additonal comforts. (To my surprise my hair actually looked better than when I use expensive products from home.) A toiletry kit can be purchased from the hotel. Toilet tissue is from a dispenser in small sheets. (You'll adjust.) The shower is fairly small so obese people should be aware of that. If you book online a "cot" means a baby crib in the U.K. In the U.S. a cot is a portable folding single bed. I accidentally reserved one for my 17 year old daughter not realizing the room includes a sofa that can be made into a single bed. All in all a great choice, great price, and very comfortable.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Recommend a day trip to Brighton. One hour south of London by express train from Victoria Station. Spectacular seaside town featuring a palace retreat (Royal Pavillion) w/ beautiful gardens, boardwalk w/ small amusement park, great restaurants/shopping.
reviews.title: a relaxing nights sleep

reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights at the Premier Inn, Euston, and what a great location. Just across the road from Euston Station, which is ideal for all your underground travelling.
reviews.title: Great Location & friendly staff
Bargain with excellent customer service
reviews.text: The Booking in was easy, and all electronic, had to pay upfront, which I was not to pleased about, as other Premier Inn`s we stayed at paid on leaving.

reviews.title: Absolutely appalling - "good nights guarantee" is a lie
reviews.text: My husband stayed at the Premier Inn Euston on the night of the 11th December 2012 in room 434. Booking Reference number AKUR615610.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: He had no sleep, whatsoever. on check out he reported the problems experienced and nothing was said. not even an apology.
reviews.title: Great accommodation and convenient location
Avoid this hotel!!!
reviews.text: He arrived at the "hotel" at 10pm only to be told that their "systems were down so he could not check in" he sat in reception for nearly two hours until he was given access to his room just before midnight. The room was freezing cold and he assumed the heating had not been turned on. He turned it up and pulled the curtains, at which point the curtain rail fell off the wall. He called reception, no answer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After an hour the room was still freezing cold, he called reception again, no answer.
reviews.title: Good base for seeing the sights

reviews.text: He checked out early the next morning, after a sleepless night. On check out he told them the heating wasn't working and the room was freezing cold. Nothing was said about the Good Nights Guarantee, no apology was given.
reviews.title: Great premier inn, in good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Could not have asked for better service and food for a budget hotel, staff are very friendly and helpful, room was exactly as shown in the internet. Great value for money.
reviews.title: 5 star service for a budget hotel

reviews.text: Stayed with my mother, who unfortunately booked a double room which i didnt know about until i got there.
reviews.title: Good
No-nonsense, no problems
reviews.text: Quiet. Clean. GREAT food in the retaurant. Good location. Everything you could need.
You know what you're geting with a premier inn.
reviews.title: Not the Quietest Hotel Room...!

reviews.text: Wouldnt reccomend for romantic getaways but would recomend for one or two night stays.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - worth the money

reviews.text: The purpose of my trip was to attend a training course in Russell Square. Arriving into Euston made the Premier Inn on Dukes Road an ideal location. It is literally minutes from Euston Station. The Reception staff at the hotel gave a very warm welcome, the check-in process was quick and the Receptionist pointed out the restuarant, gave dinner and breakfast times etc. The room, at the back of the hotel, was clean, comfortable and quiet. The beds at all Premier Inns are superb, huge and comfy. The bathroom was spotlessly clean, the shower great! The hotel was let down by poor service in the restuarant. The waiter came and took my order and I then sat for 25 minutes until he came back and said he had forgotten what I had ordered. I re-ordered; starter, main and a drink, and then waited about 10 minutes for the starter. The food is good, a decent choice on the menu and good value for money. Sadly, the service was a let down. When I had finished, the waiter presented me with a bill despite the fact that I had pre-paid for dinner. This wouldn't put me off using the hotel again, it is ideally located, clean, comfortable and good value for money - maybe they should just buy the waiter an order pad and pencil! The rest of the staff were friendly, helpful and efficient - the waiter too was friendly, just not a very good waiter!
reviews.title: Ideal location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are frequent guests in Premier Inns in UK cities when all we want is a comfortable warm base for a few days. We also stayed at this hotel in February last year and the Euston Premier Inn is an excellent choice close to stations, buses, cafes and restaurants. The hotel is very quiet if you stay in a rear facing room. Street side, it can suffer slightly from some some siren noise as there is an ambulance/fire station down the street. NB - we also also noticed this when we stayed in more expensive hotels nearby. There is no need to pay twice as much for these as the Premier Inn has very good rooms and facilities. DO NOT bother with breakfast as it is very busy and there are nicer and cheaper alternatives very close by. We recommend the cafe in Friend's House (Quakers) just along the street on the same side opposite Euston Station.
reviews.title: Why Pay More in London - this is THE Premier Inn!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is tops for visiting London. I stayed there Sunday to Thursday last week and as usual it has maintained its high standards. It is great value for money, has warm comfortable rooms much appreciated in the present cold spell, and very well situated. We use it because it is near the theatres, etc, and this time we were in walking distance of the show we had booked for, and as we mostly arrive by train, is so convenient just to walk across the street to the hotel.
reviews.title: A further repeat visit

reviews.text: One tiny crib, why have they depersonalised the check-in? I feel that the next time I'm there, judging by the current set up, there will be a robot instead instead of the very pleasant person who assisted us on check-in. These machines around the lobby makes it look like the inside of a bank.
reviews.title: Good stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All jokes aside this is a hotel that I will keep returning to. Keep up the good work.
reviews.title: Great service from staff

reviews.text: London hotels can sometimes be a gamble but this was really good - what you expect from the 'brand'. Clean, quiet and comfortable room. Booked online - quick and easy. Used the self service check in machines (great idea - quick and easy again). Staff were polite, helpful and efficient - and no disapproval when we didn't want to eat in the hotel. Very handy for our rail station. Perfect for sightseeing and theatre trip via Euston; St Pancras or Kings Cross. We will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent and great value choice

reviews.text: Really enjoyed our stay in this hotel. Close to train station and underground. Staff extremely friendly and helpful. Rooms good size, clean and quiet. Food very good with great choice. Will definetely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great hotel in great location
Excellent location, very quiet, good price!

reviews.text: We've stayed in other Premier Inn's and always found them good, this one was no exception, it was really close to King's Cross, a five minute walk. Our room was fine, not huge but perfectly acceptable. It was very quiet as it faced the inner courtyard area. The staff were very helpful, everywhere was really clean and it was ideal for our short break as it was so close to the underground at Euston.
reviews.title: Great price, great room, great food - thoroughly recommended

reviews.text: We got a good deal for the room, didn't eat in the restaurant but used the Costa which is on the corner, it was lovely sitting outside with a chilled drink in the sunshine!
reviews.title: central and worthy of your stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On my vacation I stayed at 2 hotels in Paris and one in London, and this was the best of the three.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.text: Pros: Room and bathroom very comfortable, modern and good size. Staff very cordial. Good location, especially if you travel by Eurostar. Very comfortable bed. Restaurant surprisingly good for a budget hotel
reviews.title: Disappointing rooms for the price

reviews.text: Cons: Breakfast good but with a poor variety
reviews.title: Everything's premier but the food....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had reserved a family room. It had a double bed for adults plus a lumpy mattress on the floor (not an aerobed) for each kid. Room was noisy (though less so w/ double windows closed, but then it was hot, as AC didn't work). Towels were only supplied for 1 or 2 persons, though more were given upon request. After 2 nights we changed to a different double rm. on high floor facing the back, which was OK, plus a separate room for the kids, which smelled strongly of cigarette smoke. They said no other rm. was available, though we had requested change 2 days earlier.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: Good points: 1) convenient location. 2)Good breakfast. 3)They did inform us of guarantee, which we used for 1 night, but I feel we should have used it for both of the nights we were stuck in the quad room. 4)Staff was pleasant.
reviews.title: A FANTASTIC EXPERIENCE

reviews.text: Superb customer sevice, hotel spotlessly clean and the meal deal is excellent value, lovely three course meal in the restaurant (and its an actual restuarant not a 'pub add on') and a fantastic breakfast.
reviews.title: Excellent all round

reviews.text: Staff were very attentive and courteous.
reviews.title: An excellent weekend - The Hayat Family

reviews.text: Room was spotless, comfortable bed and what joy to have a 'proper' duvet and pillows
reviews.title: Excellent overall experience

reviews.text: Well done Premier!
reviews.title: A regular visitor

reviews.text: We stayed at Premier Inn Euston in Jan 2013. All staff were extremely helpful and polite at all times. Our requests were handled very politely and efficiently. Hotel was very clean and restaruant food, including breakfast was very nice. Hotel is located close to tube stations and major railways. We would particulary like to say thank you to Anup (restaruant staff) who was very friendly, built a rapport with the kids and was extremly polite and understood our dietry requirements. We will definatly be staying in premier inn again and will recommend to friends and family.
reviews.title: Thanks

aka: Premier Inn London Euston Hotel London
